asked the Minister of Economic Development:
(i) whether the Thirikkonduyadumadu-Jayanthipura Road in the Eastern Province is a road proposed for development;
(ii) if so, whether this road is being developed by now?
(b) If this road is being developed, will he inform this House of-
(ii) the proposed date for the completion of its work; and
(iii) the amount of money estimated for this purpose?
(i) whether tenders were called for the construction of this road;
(ii) if so, the names of institutions that submitted tenders;
(iii) the bids forwarded by the respective institutions; and
(iv) the institution for which the tender was awarded and the price of bid?
(i) whether the total amount of estimated money for the construction of this road was obtained from local funds;
(ii) if not, whether it was obtained through foreign aid; and
(iii) if foreign aid was obtained, the name of the donor country?

: DIVISIONAL SECRETARY'S DIVISIONS IN MATARA DISTRICT: SAMURDHI RECIPIENTS 0937/10
asked the Minister of Economic Development :
(a) Will he state separately and in relation to each Divisional Secretary's Division in the Matara District -
(i) the amount of money spent to grant assistance to Samurdhi recipients;
(ii) the number of families that received Samurdhi benefits;
(iii) the number of Samurdhi recipients who handed their Samurdhi subsidy cards back to the Government owing to economic advancement; and
(iv) the number of families for which the Samurdhi benefits were granted afresh;
during the five years from June 2005 to June 2010 annually?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena) , * .

: MISS RIZANA NAFEEK : DEATH SENTENCE 0981/10 14. .. ( .. ) (The Hon. M.T. Hasen Ali) - (3) :
() , ? asked the Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare :
(i) the Islamic Sharia law is the law in force in Saudi Arabia;

(ii) when a death sentence is imposed on an individual by court in terms of the Shariah Law, that the completion of 18 years of age of the convict on the date the illegal act or crime committed is taken into consideration;
(iii) the real age of Miss Rizana Nafeek who has been sentenced to death in Saudi Arabia at present was 17 years at the time this criminal charge was levelled against her ?

(i) the measures that have been taken against the officials who assisted in issuing the forged birth certificate, National Identity Card and Sri Lanka passport to Miss Rizana and the Justice of the Peace who certified the application for Sri Lanka passport and the foreign employment agent who assisted her to go abroad;

(ii) whether he admits that the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment which failed to make proper submissions when the case against Rizana was being heard in that country, should accept the full responsibility for the imposition of said sentence on her ?
( - , ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera - Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare)

() . 5000 . , 2007 . ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) . ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Minister, you had mentioned at a press conference that one of the parents had agreed to get the "blood money" and hence a pardon would be given to the girl. What about the second parent that was involved in this issue?

( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera) According to the Islamic Shariah Law, we have to get the consent from both the parents and then, of course, they will stipulate an amount as blood money. So, we are trying by various means to get the consent from both the parents. It is a very sensitive issue on both sides. So, we want to use all unofficial methods and be very cordial towards them and try to get their consent.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) The Second Supplementary Question that I would like to pose is that until you assumed office, this particular issue was approached somewhat in a lackadaisical manner. So, what measures can be taken to invigorate the Ministry of External Affairs as well as the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Saudi Arabia in order to ensure such things will not happen in the future?
We are lucky that you have been able to intervene and take this forward. If no such action taken, this girl's death would have occurred.

( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera) Well, Hon. Member, the reply to that question is, according to the law of that country, which is known as Shariah Law, even the King cannot give pardon. The official pardon can be given with the consent of the parents and after the stipulation of the "blood money." But, after His Excellency the President made a request, that country has been good enough to suspend the execution of the punishment temporarily. But, that does not mean that it is a total pardon. So, we must deal with the situation in a manner that will not harm the cordial relationship between the two countries. At the moment we can go on at least with the suspension of the execution until we get the consent of the parents because the law says very clearly that she can only be pardoned with the consent of the parents and after the stipulation of the "blood money".

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, I want to ask the next question. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) My third Supplementary Question: the foreign people were held negligent in a similar way with regard to the case of one Mr. Sunil Shanthas daughter in Colombo North who jumped off a particular building and died. But, no action has been taken by the Sri Lankan Embassy there and the Foreign Employment Bureau. Why? ( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera) Hon. Member, had it happened in Jordan? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) No, Hon. Minister, it had happened in Kuwait.

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, that is not relevant. ( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera) I cannot remember that incident. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) It happened three weeks ago and the person who died was from Colombo North. ( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera) Right, now I remember. That girl jumped off the building and of course, the parents thought that it was more than a suicide and suspected foul play. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Yes, foul play. ( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera) I have appointed a special committee and sent a special officer also there to get me a report on that matter. I am awaiting that report at the moment.

(ii) the names of the institutions investigated as per the above reports; and
(iii) the actions that have been initiated with the directions of the Committee Report?

( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) ? How can you say no bank went bankrupt? Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, if you remember, your former Prime Minister, the late Hon. D.B. Wijetunga got up and made a statement before Parliament and said the Peoples Bank has gone bankrupt and the Opposition protested and he had to withdraw it. We had to intervene in order to prevent bank depositors withdrawing money over that statement. . , , . ( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe) .

( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe) We recapitalized the two State banks because there were problems, and it was only at that time the then Prime Minister, the late Hon. D.B. Wijetunga as the Minister of Finance said, Because the banks have no money, we have to recapitalize. So, there was no question of money being withdrawn because money was being pumped in to prevent the money being withdrawn. No bank collapsed to my knowledge during the UNP times. I think only one small non-commercial bank had a problem during the year 2000. But, I must say that I have not heard of any bank having difficulties; finance companies have had, but not banks.
( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , .. . . . , . ,-[ ] ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) . . . ,-[ ] ?
: : CEREMONY TO MARK UNIVERSAL POSTAL DAY: MONEY SPENT 1170/11
5. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Tissa Attanayake) - (1):
asked the Minister of Postal Services:
(i) a ceremony was held on 04.01.2010 at the auditorium of the National Apprentice Board at Katubedda to mark the Universal Postal Day;
(ii) in addition to that, a get together cum a dinner party was held on the ship Jetliner by a group of officials of the Department of Posts to commemorate that day?
(i) )the amount of money spent by the Department of Posts for the aforesaid party; and
(ii) whether due approval had been obtained to spend funds in that manner ?

(i) whether he admits that it is not reasonable to spend money in this manner leaving aside the necessity to meet the service requirements and the staff requirements of the Department of Posts which incurs an annual loss of nearly Rs. 26 billion; and
(ii) of the measures that will be taken in this respect ?
(d) If not, why ? ( ) (The Hon. Jeewan Kumaranatunga) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:

: : RANAJAYAPURA IPALOGAMA HOUSING SCHEME: IMPOSITION OF CHARGE 1172/11
10. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Tissa Attanayake) - (1):
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs:

(i) it was declared to the country by the authorities of the Api Wenuwen Api war heroes fund over the media that steps would be taken under that project to collect funds and build houses for war heroes;
(ii) a huge amount of money has been donated to that fund by local as well as foreign philanthropists on behalf of war heroes; and
(iii) war heroes are charged in providing houses built at the housing scheme at Ranajayapura, Ipalogama, under this scheme ?
(b) Will he admit that it is not fair to-
(i) charge for providing houses while claiming to build houses for war heroes free of charge; and
(ii) evict the war heroes who were not willing to pay ?

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) 6 point of Order . ? 6 point of Order . ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) What is your point of Order, Hon. Member? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) My point of Order is this: at the Party Leaders Meeting it was agreed that Questions should be answered. So, when a Question is postponed for the third time, I am compelled to ask you to intervene and get an answer for it. For every Question that is asked in this Parliament, Rs. 63,800 is being spent. ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) You can raise it at the Party Leaders' Meeting. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Well, we did it. We cannot be raising it at every moment at the Party Leaders Meeting. What is happening in the House has to be looked into by the House. ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Raise it at the Party Leaders Meeting.
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Is the Party Leaders' Meeting more superior than Parliament?

: : OFFICERS OF ARMED FORCES : PENSION BENEFITS
15. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga on behalf of the Hon. Tissa Attanayake) - (1):
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs:
(i) only the war heroes who have completed a 05 year service in operational areas are entitled to 85 per cent of the pension as per 6/2010 Circular issued by the Government; and
(ii) the officers of the three armed forces serve in various areas of the country on the administrative service requirements of the relevant force and not on the personal will of their own?
(b) Will he admit that all officers of the three armed forces should be accorded equal treatment on retirement?

(c) If so, will he state whether the relevant authorities will be instructed to remove the anomaly resulting from computing the percentage of pension taking into account the service in operational areas?

QUESTION BY PRIVATE NOTICE ASSAULT AT TAMIL NATIONAL ALLIANCE PARTY MEETING IN JAFFNA . ( . ) (The Hon. R. Sampanthan) Thank you, Mr. Deputy Speaker for giving me this opportunity to raise a question relating to a matter of public importance in regard to an incident which happened on Thursday, the 16th of June, 2011 at Allaveddi in the Jaffna District. Sir, my Statement is as follows:

On Thursday, the 16th of June, 2011, the Tamil National Alliance had a meeting with our party activists and candidates to the Valigamam North Pradeshiya Sabha, to have a discussion about the forthcoming Local Government Elections, at a hall in Allaveddi in the Tellippallai police area. The police and the army had visited the place earlier in the day and made inquiries about the meeting. The meeting commenced at about 6.30 p.m. with about 30 party members. The Members of Parliament of the Tamil National Alliance, the Hon. Mavai S. Senathirajah, the Hon. Suresh Premachandran, the Hon. A. Vinayagamoorthy, the Hon. E. Saravanapavan, the Hon. S. Shritharan and the Hon. M.A. Sumanthiran attended the meeting. The Hon. A. Vinayagamoorthy left the meeting early.

At about 7.30 p.m., while the meeting was in progress, some army personnel entered the hall and gave orders to stop the meeting. The Hon. M.A. Sumanthiran walked up to an officer who seemed to be in the rank of a Major and spoke to him and he was told that the meeting could not proceed since the TNA had not got police permission. While he was explaining that this was an internal party meeting that did not require any police permission and that in any case that was the matter between the police and us and not the military, several soldiers in full uniform, carrying automatic weapons and long poles in their hands, rushed into the hall and started assaulting the people. About 30 of them were led by an

officer who wore a T-shirt and army fatigue trousers and boots. He went up to the Hon. E. Saravanapavan and pulled out the microphone and raised his pole to assault him. The Hon. E. Saravanapavans security personnel intervened and they were dealt a few blows. The other MSD personnel formed a ring around the other Members of Parliament and identified themselves as police personnel. They were assaulted with the poles. The person who led the attack, pointed a finger at the Hon. Premachandran, and threatened and abused him. Many other candidates and party workers also were beaten and chased out of the hall. When the Parliamentarians were leaving, at the entrance again the soldiers came up and assaulted the Hon. Mavai S. Senathirajahs security personnel. People were being assaulted outside the hall at that time also.
The Hon. Senathirajah telephoned Jaffna Security Forces Commander, Major General Mahinda Hathurusinghe and reported the matter to him.

He called back and found that the MPs were at the Tellipalai Police Station and sent Major General Walgama and other army officers. Major General Walgama expressed his regret and offered his apology. He also requested the MPs not to make a complaint to the police. But, the MPs told him that they will have to necessarily lodge a complaint and proceeded to make statements to the police. The MSD personnel who were injured also made statements and received treatment at the hospital. We understand that the police have reported facts to court the next day but have said that the said assault was carried out by unidentified persons in army uniform.

Major General Hathurusinghe initially issued a statement saying that this was a minor incident involving the army and the MSD personnel. But, later when he met the MPs on Saturday, he claimed that he had been misquoted by the press and assured them that the TNA can engage in the campaign work and that he would ensure that such incidents do not recur. He had assured the MPs that if this was done by the army, he would take stern disciplinary action.

We have quite clearly stated that this was in fact the army and no one else. No one in his right mind will accept that 30 to 50 men can walk around in Jaffna wearing army uniforms, armed with automatic weapons and speaking in Sinhala, without it actually being the army. However, on Monday 20th June, the Defence Secretary himself has stated in the "Island" newspaper that it was in fact the army that stopped the said meeting from proceeding. If that is the case, why have the miscreants not been arrested so far? The Defence Secretarys statement shows clearly that the miscreants can be identified.

This is a very serious attack on democracy, a flagrant violation of human rights and the freedom to engage in legitimate and democratic political activity in Jaffna. It confirms again that the military is attempting to rule Jaffna totally disregarding the rule of law. We call for urgent and immediate action to arrest the culprits whose identity is known to the authorities and that disciplinary and criminal proceedings be instituted. It is also clear that this assault was premeditated and was carried out by the army itself openly in uniform with impunity. The motive is also clearly political and intended to intimidate the voting public, the candidates, the Members of Parliament and prevent a free and fair election.

We call upon the Government to act immediately and apprehend the offenders. On our part, we wish to reiterate that we are committed to working with the Government on matters of urgent concern of our people and also to find an acceptable and long-lasting political solution within a united country.

We call upon all right-thinking people to denounce this act of violence by the army against democratic political activity and also to support us in a bid for a just and acceptable political solution to the national question.

Before I conclude, Sir, I wish to quote from what Lord Gautama Buddha, the noblest Son of Asia, has said in regard to violence and conquest. But, before I do that, may I urge this House to come to the following conclusions from the statement I have read.

The first is, the loudspeaker permit needs to be obtained from the police when a loudspeaker is used. No loudspeaker was used in this instance and there was no need for any permission to be obtained from the police or anyone else. Moreover, this was an indoor meeting attended only by party candidates and a few party activists and was not open to the public. The second is, five Parliamentarians were prevented by this violence from holding a meeting in their own electoral district. The third is, the military is able to act in this manner with impunity because a state of Emergency prevails in the country paralysing the normal laws under which the rule of law should be upheld.
We ask that the state of Emergency be repealed forthwith and we state that no free and fair election upholding impartially and independently democratic values can be held under a state of Emergency.

I would now like to read what Lord Gautama Buddha has stated, Sir. He stated, "The only conquest that brings peace and happiness is self conquest. One may conquer millions in battle but he who conquers himself only one, is the greatest of conquerors". This is what Lord Gautama
Buddha, the noblest Son of Asia had to say. This is something which I think all people in this country, big or small should accept, remember and adhere to.
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Is there a reply from the Government? - [Interruption.] There is a reply and thereafter, a Privilege Matter will be raised by the Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer.
( .. - , ) (The Hon. D.M. Jayaratne - Prime Minister, Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs) , 23(2) . 11 . . . . 2011 21 . . . . . . . . . . . , ; .
: 2011.06.21 : 2011.06.21 PRIVILEGE: MISREPORTING OF SPEECH MADE IN PARLIAMENT ON 21.06.2011 BY MEDIA
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Bismillahir Rahmanir Raheem.
Hon. Deputy Speaker, thank you very much for giving me permission to raise this matter of Privilege.

Certain sections of the media have misquoted the speech I made in Parliament yesterday. In my speech I have not said anywhere that the wife and children of Prabhakaran are safe and sound, and that they are looked after by the President. I think they are with the Opposition. They are with the Opposition at Sirikotha perhaps - [Interruption.]

All what I endeavoured was to draw a parallel between our President and some other leaders in the world, - [Interruption.] ? ? [Interruption.] - where I described the humaneness of our President - Interruption.] ( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara) Sir, I rise to a point of Order.
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, point of Order . When a matter of Privilege is being raised, there is no point of Order.
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) What is your point of Order?
( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara) Mr. Deputy Speaker, he is misleading the House. I was here yesterday when he was speaking. I have a note on what he has spoken and I have the CD as well. - [ ]
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Hon. Member, it is not a point of Order. Hon. Azwer, please raise your matter of Privilege.
[ .] [ ] [Expunged on the order of the Chair.]
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Hon. Azwer, please continue.

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) All what I endeavoured was to draw a parallel between our President and some of the other leaders in the world, where I described the humaneness of our President when compared to the inhuman attitudes of certain other leaders in the world. [Interruption.]
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) I gave you a hearing. That is not a point of Order.

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) What I intended saying was that the late Thamil Chelvans wife and children were looked after well after his death. I admit that I made a mistake and mentioned the name of Prabhakaran instead of Thamil Chelvan. This so happened since I was in a hurry to finish my speech as was beckoned to by the Deputy Speaker and I perhaps failed to mention the latters name. - [Interruption.] ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Order, please. Let the Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer raise it. [Interruption.]
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) . -[Interruption.] Although I apologize to you and to the House, Sir, - [Interruption.]

( ) (The Deputy Speaker) What is your point of Order? ... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, no point of Order can be raised when I am raising a matter of Privilege. ( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara) . . ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) No, that is not a point of Order. , . ... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) class .
[ .] [ ] [Expunged on the order of the Chair.]
Although I apologize to you and to the House, Sir, for the mix-up of characters, I still would emphasize - [Interruption.]

No member shall impute improper motives to any other member

Now, Sir, the Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara was imputing motives to me when he started his speech. It is contrary to Standing Orders. According to the information provided, Foreigners were conspicuous among the former Prime Ministers advisors. A Mr. John Earl who was brought down by Ranil Wickremesinghe for publicity work during the 1999 Presidential Election and later named as consultant to the unit set up to develop a master plan for Strategic Communication and paid 239,280 US dollars per year. Accordingly his monthly pay was 19,940 US dollars or Rs. 2,053,820. It is also a well guarded but popular secret that whatever his designation John Earls main function appeared to be that of selecting the former Prime Ministers clothing, and providing him with speech training and strategies to create dissension in opposition ranks. A reflection of The Prime Ministers insecurities perhaps! A certain Mr. A.G. Cuthbertson who was appointed as an advisor for strengthening Government capacity was paid 227,625 US dollars per year which amounted to Rs. 1,953,781 monthly.
( ) (The Hon. Rohana Dissanayake) . RFID - Radio Frequency Identification, GIS -Geographic Information System, GPS - Global Positioning System-
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) The Adjournment Motion is to be moved by the Hon. Ravi Karunanayake.
SALE OF LAND BELONGING TO ARMY HEADQUARTERS
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Thank you, Hon. Deputy Speaker, for making me available to move the Adjournment Motion.

The UPFA Government which has been promising no privatization not selling land to overseas parties without charging 100% taxes (from non-Sri Lankans) has been pursuing a policy to the contrary. They have been selling land which belonged to the Army Headquarters to Shangri-La and Catic (a Hong Kong Company). We have been informed that the receipts of the sales proceeds had not been disclosed as to where it has been posted. Therefore, we call upon the Minister to advise as to whether there has been a change of policy as to where the money has been credited 11.7 Billion taxes have been paid, if not how much have been paid as taxes and how many acres of land what has been the sales proceeds of this sale to these two institutions.

, . . , '' ; ; 100 '' . ? 2G scam . - 2G scam - . notional profit . That is only a notional value that was placed on certain allocations made by one of the Ministers. , . . . ; . . ; . , . . . . . . . . , .
- BOI . BOI , Sri Lanka Development Authority . ? BOI . Sri Lanka Development Authority . , , ? ? BOI , , .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) You have already taken 14 minutes.
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Would you stop me at 20 minutes so that the other 10 minutes could be used by the Hon. (Dr.) Harsha De Silva?
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Thank you, Sir.

So, all what we want to do is to fortify, strengthen and develop the economy. This is not an economy left only for the UPFA.We are the ones who brought independence to this country. We are the ones who have prime moved and brought development to this country. We are the ones who know how to integrate Sri Lanka with the world. That is what you are shredding and tearing apart. You basically bring in nationalism because that is the only thing you could use to cover all your sins. You think that spirit of nationalism will ride you through all the sins and the problems that have been created. So, I guess it is time for a wake-up call. You cannot live in the dead past all the time. You must ensure that you create a new course of activities that will be able to put Sri Lanka in the world map. You talk of investments, the tourist world, but you made such a fuss on a small question that was asked. We asked as to why on earth the Government is silent still on Channel 4. Two years ago the Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe said he will take them to court. Why have you not done that? If you are frightened, please tell us and we will go on your behalf. That is the only way you can bring investments into the country; that is the only way you can bring stability to this country; that is the only way you can clear the bad name that has been created by any treacherous person, whoever he maybe. We can only support you. When you have a problem anytime, the easiest way is to put the blame on the UNP. But, we have been able to charter a course to help you. We, as the Opposition, have been most responsible in helping you. That is why you have Karuna Amman as a Deputy Minister. Who was he earlier? He was second to Prabhakaran. Today he is a Deputy Minister. How? Because you had a Peace Accord signed those days. He himself says that he saw a different world from the day that the Peace Accord was signed. But, you never give us that credit. What did Mr. Barack Obama say when Bin Laden was killed? He first called Mr. George Bush and said, "What you have started, I have concluded". That is how credit was given. What did Mr.Tony Blair do when the Good Friday Accord was signed? All what he did

was, he called his predecessor, John Major and said, "You and I have together charted a new course. This is what the United Kingdom wants and today we are signing the Good Friday Accord for the good of the United Kingdom". But, what is happening here? Everything is revolving around one person: |"I am the president; I am the person; I am the only one". All the debit is given to the UNP and all the credit is given to the Government. This is the insincerity that is there. Then, you want us to come and save the country. We do not care. We will protect the country because it is not only your country but also the country of all of us.
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Hon. Member, you have already taken 20 minutes.
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Thank you very much, Sir.
, , CIMA "CIMA National Leaders' Summit" conference . Chief Guest .. . Keynote address , Shangri-La . .

The revenue has increased from Rs. 240 billion to Rs. 284 billion for the first four months when we compare 2010 with 2011. That is an 18.4 per cent increase in taxes. These taxes have come from the common man. For a mobile phone call, if you spend Rs. 100, I think the Government takes something close to Rs. 20 or 25. If you buy some dhal, some milk powder or petrol, you pay a significant amount of taxes. So, the issue is very relevant. If the Government is taking taxes from the general public of this country, we would like to know whether these investors have been duly taxed or not.
, , Shangri-La . , , . , . , Shangri-La . CATIC . . . , Grant Skyline Hotel . Shangri-La CATIC

. , Shangri-La CATIC . . , . , . . . JF-17 Fighters, F-8T Fighters, FBC-1 Fighter Bombers, CZ11W Light Attack Helicopters, LT-2 Laser Guided Bombs, LT-3 Laser Guided Bombs, LS-6 Glide Guided Bombs Galle Face - .- 4 US Dollar 50 ? , what is the justification for that? What is the justification to sell the prime land of Sri Lanka purportedly to build a hotel to a fighter aircraft manufacturing company? I just do not understand this. If it is Hilton Hotel, if it is Shangri-La Hotel, if it is Marriott Hotel or if it is some other hotel company, then obviously there is some connection. But, here there is no connection. So, I expect the Hon Minister to give a justifiable answer to this series of questions we have raised.
Thank you very much. ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) . ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena - Deputy Minister of Economic Development) , , . . , , . . , , .
